alert.note: Alert for San Saba (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 21 at 7:35PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...Several rapidly developing strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central San Saba County through 815 PM CDT... At 733 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking several strong thunderstorms along the Colorado River from north of Richland Springs southeast to Chappel. The storms are moving slowly southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central San Saba County, including the following locations... Harkeyville and Spring Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
